accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford University, Task Force on the Area One Requirement, Western Culture Program Records (SC0396). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Task Force, established by the Provost in September 1986, was charged with making a comprehensive review of the undergraduate curriculum requirement in Area One (cultures, ideas, and values) in light of faculty and student concerns about the inclusion of women, minorities, and non-European cultures in the curriculum.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE NOTE
scopecontent.p: The Task Force on the Area One Requirement, established by the Provost in September, 1986, was charged with making a comprehensive review of the undergraduate curriculum requirements in Area One (cultures, ideas, and values) in light of faculty and student concerns about the inclusion of women, minorities, and non-European cultures in the curriculum. These records consist of minutes, correspondence, proposals, legislation, and reports of the Task Force as well as syllabi and clippings.
